chapter.title: Citrix XenServer Installation and Configuration
chapter.para: Citrix XenServer 5.6 GA must be installed on the Hosts. Citrix XenServer can be downloaded from the Citrix Website (http://www.citrix.com/lang/English/lp/lp_1688615.asp) and installed using the Citrix XenServer Installation Guide.

important.para: All hosts must be 64-bit and must support HVM (Intel-VT or AMD-V enabled). All Hosts within a Cluster must be homogenous. That means the CPUs must be of the same type, count, and feature flags. See http://docs.vmd.citrix.com/XenServer/4.0.1/reference/ch02.html for more information on homogenous XenServer hosts.
You must re-install Citrix XenServer if you are going to re-use a host from a previous install.
The CloudStack requires XenServer 5.6. XenServer 5.5 update 2 is not supported. XenServer 5.6 FP1 is not supported.

section.title: Username and Password
section.para: All XenServers in a Cluster must have the same username and password as configured in the CloudStack.

section.title: Physical Networking Setup
section.para: Once XenServer has been installed you may need to do some additional network configuration. At this point in the installation, you should have a plan for what NICs the Host will have and what traffic each NIC will carry. The NICs should be cabled as necessary to implement your plan.
The IP address assigned for the private network interface must be static. It can be set on the host itself or obtained via static DHCP.
This document will only cover the configuration of a single NIC, multi-nic, multi-vlan, and bonded NIC setups are discussed in the Installation guide
